original: @155b # // yang bham ga la'i bud med cig gi khyo shi nas yid dgas su skyes te des bdag tu bzung nas rtag tu 'ong ba la yul dbus kyi tshong dpon cig gis shar phyogs su tshong la phyin te der bzhag nas g-yog gis rkang pa bkrus /
analyzed: @155b # // yang bham ga la'i bud med cig gi khyo shi nas yid dgas su skyes te des bdag tu bzung nas rtag tu 'ong ba la yul dbus kyi tshong dpon cig gis shar phyogs su tshong la phyin te der bzhag nas g-yog gis rkang pa bkrus /
translated: Also, a woman of Bhamgala whose husband had died became a hungry ghost. She took possession of him and always came. A merchant of Magadha went on a business trip to the east. He stayed there and his servant washed his feet.

original: khrus dang bskul nye byas te ston thog tu yi ge drug pa'i sgom bzlas byed gyi na bsdad do //
analyzed: khrus dang bskul nye byas te ston thog tu yi ge drug pa'i sgom bzlas byed gyi na bsdad do //
translated: After bathing and anointing him, he sat down to meditate on the six-syllable mantra.

original: der yi dags des nang du @156a * //
analyzed: der yi dags des nang du @156a * //
translated: The hungry ghost was unable to enter inside.

original: 'ong ma nus par phyi nas ku lu ku lu zer zhing tshong dpon phyir thon gyi sgra brjod pa bud med des mthong ste blo skyes nas tshong dpon la phyag dang bsnyen bkur byas te bdag la'ang de bslab par zhu zhes gsol nas nyams su blangs nas de
analyzed: 'ong ma nus par phyi nas ku lu ku lu zer zhing tshong dpon phyir thon gyi sgra brjod pa bud med des mthong ste blo skyes nas tshong dpon la phyag dang bsnyen bkur byas te bdag la'ang de bslab par zhu zhes gsol nas nyams su blangs nas de
translated: From outside, she cried, “Kulu kulu,” and the sound of the merchant coming out was heard. The woman saw this and the idea came to her. She made prostrations and service to the merchant and requested, “Please teach this to me.” She practiced it and
it is said that she was liberated from that.

original: bud med kyis grub pa thob pa ni bi na ya shr'is bsgyur ro//
analyzed: bud med kyis grub pa thob pa ni bi na ya shr'is bsgyur ro//
translated: The attainment of a woman is translated by Vinayashri.
